Rule.Name: Per Share (mrq) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: A Fundamental Item per Share for the most-recent quarter (mrq). Possible values: Assets, Book Value, Current Assets, Income, Sales, Total Inventories, and Total Receivables. Enter the value in dollars per share; e.g. 20 = $20/share
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Per Share (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Per Share (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: A Fundamental Item per Share for the trailing twelve months (ttm). Possible values: Assets, Book Value, Current Assets, Income, Sales, Total Inventories, and Total Receivables. Enter the value in dollars per share; e.g. 20 = $20/share
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Per Share (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Per Share (mrq) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: A Fundamental Item per Share for the most-recent quarter (mrq). Possible values: Assets, Book Value, Current Assets, Income, Sales, Total Inventories, and Total Receivables. Enter the value in dollars per share; e.g. 20 = $20/share
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Per Share (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Per Share (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: A Fundamental Item per Share for the trailing twelve months (ttm). Possible values: Assets, Book Value, Current Assets, Income, Sales, Total Inventories, and Total Receivables. Enter the value in dollars per share; e.g. 20 = $20/share
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Per Share (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Growth Rate (qtr over qtr) is above a Pct
Rule.Description: Growth rate is expressed as percentage growth with respect to the specified number of Quarters ago. For example: 10 = 10% growth quarter over quarter (qoq)
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Growth Rate over " + <#Quarters>.ToString() + " quarters";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Growth Rate (qtr over qtr) is below a Pct
Rule.Description: Growth rate is expressed as percentage growth with respect to the specified number of Quarters ago. For example: 10 = 10% growth quarter over quarter (qoq)
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Growth Rate over " + <#Quarters>.ToString() + " quarters";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Price/Fundamental ratio (ttm) is below a ratio
Rule.Description: Price/Fundamental ratio annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm). Valid fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Price/<#Fundamental> Ratio (annual)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Price/Fundamental ratio (ttm) is above a ratio
Rule.Description: Price/Fundamental ratio annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm). Valid fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Price/<#Fundamental> Ratio (annual)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Fundamental (mrq) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: A Fundamental Item for the most-recent quarter (mrq).
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

RuleParameter.Name: Fundamental
RuleParameter.DefaultValue: accounts payable;assets;cash;cash dividends;common shares outstanding;current assets;current liabilities;interest expense;liabilities;long term debt;net income;operating activities;operating income before depreciation;pretax income;property plant and equipment;research and development expense;sales turnover;stock compensation expense;stockholder equity;total inventories;total receivables;

Rule.Plotting:

PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> (ttm)";

Rule.Name: Fundamental (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: A Fundamental Item for the trailing twelve month (ttm).
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

RuleParameter.Name: Fundamental
RuleParameter.DefaultValue: assets;cash;cash dividends;common shares used to calculate eps diluted;current assets;current liabilities;ebit;employee;goodwill;liabilities;long term debt;net income;operating activities;operating income before depreciation;pretax income;sales turnover;stockholder equity;

Rule.Name: Return on Fundamental (mrq) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Return on fundamental item percentage (Assets or Equity) for the most recent quarter (mrq).
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Return on <#Fundamental> (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Return on Fundamental (mrq) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Return on fundamental percentage (Assets or Equity) for the most recent quarter (mrq).
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Return on <#Fundamental> (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Return on Fundamental (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Return on fundamental percentage for the trailing 12 months (ttm). Assets or Equity is aggregated and averaged for the previous 4 quarters.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Return on <#Fundamental> (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Return on Fundamental (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Return on fundamental percentage for the trailing 12 months (ttm). Assets or Equity is aggregated and averaged for the previous 4 quarters.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Return on <#Fundamental> (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Current Ratio (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Current Ratio is annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm) by aggregating and dividing current assets by current liabilities for the past 4 quarters.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsRatio> = FundamentalsRatio.RatioSeries( this, "current assets", "current liabilities", true );
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Current Ratio (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Current Ratio (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Current Ratio is annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm) by aggregating and dividing current assets by current liabilities for the past 4 quarters.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsRatio> = FundamentalsRatio.RatioSeries( this, "current assets", "current liabilities", true );
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Current Ratio (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Current Ratio (mrq) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Current Ratio for the most-recent quarter (mrq) is calculated by dividing current assets by current liabilities.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsRatio> = FundamentalsRatio.RatioSeries( this, "current assets", "current liabilities", false );
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Current Ratio (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Current Ratio (mrq) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Current Ratio for the most-recent quarter (mrq) is calculated by dividing current assets by current liabilities.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsRatio> = FundamentalsRatio.RatioSeries( this, "current assets", "current liabilities", false );
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Current Ratio (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Debt to Asset Ratio (mrq) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Debt-to-Asset Ratio for the most-recent quarter (mrq). The Debt-to-Asset Ratio is calculated by dividing total liabilities by total assets.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Debt to Asset Ratio (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Debt to Asset Ratio (mrq) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Debt-to-Asset Ratio for the most-recent quarter (mrq). The Debt-to-Asset Ratio is calculated by dividing total liabilities by total assets.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Debt to Asset Ratio (mrq)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Debt to Asset Ratio (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Debt-to-Asset Ratio is annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm) by aggregating and dividing total liabilities by total assets for the past 4 quarters.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Debt to Asset Ratio (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Debt to Asset Ratio (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Debt-to-Asset Ratio is annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm) by aggregating and dividing total liabilities by total assets for the past 4 quarters.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Debt to Asset Ratio (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Return on Capital (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Return on Capital percentage for the trailing 12 months (ttm). Inventories, Receivables, Liabilities and Assets are aggregated and averaged for the previous 4 quarters.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Return on Capital (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Return on Capital (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Return on Capital percentage for the trailing 12 months (ttm). Inventories, Receivables, Liabilities and Assets are aggregated and averaged for the previous 4 quarters.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Return on Capital (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Sales per Employee (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Sales per employee (thousands of dollars) aggregated for the trailing 12 months (ttm). For example: 150 = $150,000 per employee
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Sales per Employee (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Sales per Employee (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Sales per employee (thousands of dollars) aggregated for the trailing 12 months (ttm). For example: 150 = $150,000 per employee
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Sales per Employee (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Fundamental Yield (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Dividend or Earnings Yield is annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm) and expressed as a percentage. For example: 0.5 = 0.5% yield
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Yield (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Fundamental Yield (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Dividend or Earnings Yield is annualized for the trailing 12 months (ttm) and expressed as a percentage. For example: 0.5 = 0.5% yield
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Yield (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Enterprise Value (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Enterprise Value (millions of dollars) for the trailing 12 months (ttm) is a measure of company's value calculated as market capitalization plus debt and preferred shares, minus cash and cash equivalents. For example: 12345.67 = 12 billion, 345 million, 67 thousand dollars
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Enterprise Value (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Enterprise Value (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Enterprise Value (millions of dollars) for the trailing 12 months (ttm) is a measure of company's value calculated as market capitalization plus debt and preferred shares, minus cash and cash equivalents. For example: 12345.67 = 12 billion, 345 million, 67 thousand dollars
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Enterprise Value (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Market Capitalization (ttm) is greater than a Value
Rule.Description: Market Capitalization (millions of dollars) for the trailing 12 months (ttm) is calculated by multiplying the company's stock price by the number of common shares outstanding. For example: 12345.67 = 12 billion, 345 million, 67 thousand dollars
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Market Capitalization (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Market Capitalization (ttm) is less than a Value
Rule.Description: Market Capitalization (millions of dollars) for the trailing 12 months (ttm) is calculated by multiplying the company's stock price by the number of common shares outstanding. For example: 12345.67 = 12 billion, 345 million, 67 thousand dollars
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "Market Capitalization (ttm)";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Growth Rate (year over year) is above a Pct
Rule.Description: Growth rate is expressed as percentage growth with respect to the specified number of Years ago. For example: 10 = 10% growth year over year. Valid Fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Growth Rate over " + <#Years>.ToString() + " years";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Growth Rate (year over year) is below a Pct
Rule.Description: Growth rate is expressed as percentage growth with respect to the specified number of Years ago. For example: 10 = 10% growth year over year. Valid Fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales.
Rule.Plotting:
<#dsRatio>.Description = "<#Fundamental> Growth Rate over " + <#Years>.ToString() + " years";
ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false);
PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsRatio>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Consecutive Quarters of Growth Rate above a Pct
Rule.Description: Enter the number of Consecutive Qtrs required whose growth is above the target specified for Growth Rate (Pct). Valid Fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales. Growth is relative to "Quarters-ago" cash flow. Growth Rate (Pct) can be a positive or negative number. For example, to trigger a trade when 3 (or more) consecutive quarters of at least 23.4% growth have occurred with respect to the same fiscal quarter last year, use Consecutive Qtrs = 3, Growth Rate (Pct) = 23.4, and Quarters = 4.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsCPG> = FundamentalsRatio.ConsecutiveGrowthSeries( this, FundamentalsRatio.ConvertName("<#Fundamental>"), <#Quarters>, <#Growth Rate (Pct)>, true, false ); <#dsCPG>.Description = "Consecutive quarters of <#Fundamental> Growth above " + <#Growth Rate (Pct)> + "% for " + <#Quarters>.ToString() + " quarters";
Rule.Plotting: ChartPane <#paneCPG> = CreatePane(50, true, false); PlotSeries(<#paneCPG>, <#dsCPG>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Consecutive Quarters of Growth Rate below a Pct
Rule.Description: Enter the number of Consecutive Qtrs required whose growth is below the target specified for Growth Rate (Pct). Valid Fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales. Growth is relative to "Quarters-ago" cash flow. Growth Rate (Pct) can be a positive or negative number. For example, to trigger a trade when 3 (or more) consecutive quarters of less than 23.4% growth have occurred with respect to the same fiscal quarter last year, use Consecutive Qtrs = 3, Growth Rate (Pct) = 23.4, and Quarters = 4.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsCPG> = FundamentalsRatio.ConsecutiveGrowthSeries( this, FundamentalsRatio.ConvertName("<#Fundamental>"), <#Quarters>, <#Growth Rate (Pct)>, false, false ); <#dsCPG>.Description = "Consecutive quarters of <#Fundamental> Growth under " + <#Growth Rate (Pct)> + "% for " + <#Quarters>.ToString() + " quarters";
Rule.Plotting: ChartPane <#paneCPG> = CreatePane(50, true, false); PlotSeries(<#paneCPG>, <#dsCPG>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Consecutive Years of Growth Rate above a Pct
Rule.Description: Enter the number of consecutive years required whose growth is above the target specified for Growth Rate (Pct). Valid Fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales. Growth is relative to "Years-ago". Only full fiscal years are considered. Growth Rate (Pct) can be a positive or negative number. For example, to trigger a trade when 2 (or more) consecutive years of at least 23.4% growth have occurred with respect to the previous fiscal year, use Consecutive Years = 2, Growth Rate (Pct) = 23.4, and Years = 1.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsCPG> = FundamentalsRatio.ConsecutiveGrowthSeries( this, FundamentalsRatio.ConvertName("<#Fundamental>"), <#Years>, <#Growth Rate (Pct)>, true, true ); <#dsCPG>.Description = "Consecutive years of <#Fundamental> Growth above " + <#Growth Rate (Pct)> + "% for " + <#Years>.ToString() + " years";
Rule.Plotting: ChartPane <#paneCPG> = CreatePane(50, true, false); PlotSeries(<#paneCPG>, <#dsCPG>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Consecutive Years of Growth Rate below a Pct
Rule.Description: Enter the number of consecutive years required whose growth is below the target specified for Growth Rate (Pct). Valid Fundamentals: Cash Flow, Earnings, and Sales. Growth is relative to "Years-ago". Only full fiscal years are considered. Growth Rate (Pct) can be a positive or negative number. For example, to trigger a trade when 2 (or more) consecutive years of less than 23.4% growth have occurred with respect to the previous fiscal year, use Consecutive Years = 2, Growth Rate (Pct) = 23.4, and Years = 1.
Rule.Init: DataSeries <#dsCPG> = FundamentalsRatio.ConsecutiveGrowthSeries( this, FundamentalsRatio.ConvertName("<#Fundamental>"), <#Years>, <#Growth Rate (Pct)>, false, true ); <#dsCPG>.Description = "Consecutive years of <#Fundamental> Growth under " + <#Growth Rate (Pct)> + "% for " + <#Years>.ToString() + " years";
Rule.Plotting: ChartPane <#paneCPG> = CreatePane(50, true, false); PlotSeries(<#paneCPG>, <#dsCPG>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Histogram, 50);

Rule.Name: Fundamental Item per Share is above a Value
Rule.Description: Occurs when a Fundamental Item per Share for the most-recent quarter (mrq) is above an entered value. Although this can be applied to any fundamental item, it makes the most sense for balance sheet or income statement items.
Rule.Plotting: ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false); PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsItemPerShare>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Solid, 1);

RuleParameter.Name: Fundamental Item
RuleParameter.Value: [Click here to select a Fundamental Item]
RuleParameter.DefaultValue: [Click here to select a Fundamental Item]

Rule.Name: Fundamental Item per Share is below a Value
Rule.Description: Occurs when a Fundamental Item per Share for the most-recent quarter (mrq) is below an entered value. Although this can be applied to any fundamental item, it makes the most sense for balance sheet or income statement items.
Rule.Plotting: ChartPane <#paneRatio> = CreatePane(50, true, false); PlotSeries(<#paneRatio>, <#dsItemPerShare>, Color.Purple, LineStyle.Solid, 1);

RuleParameter.Name: Fundamental Item
RuleParameter.Value: [Click here to select a Fundamental Item]
RuleParameter.DefaultValue: [Click here to select a Fundamental Item]
